subject: English Language
content:
English Studies 

Comprehension passage  

Instruction: Read the passage carefully and answer the following questions.  

 

Mr Eddie 

Mr Eddie lived in a farm with his wife . 

He went to the market every weekend 

To sell his farm’s fruit and vegetables . 

He was a kind man and wanted to help out those who needed it    

   Answer the questions correctly  

1. Who did mr Eddie live with?  

a) his wife b) his labors c) farm animals  

2. When does Mr Eddie go to market? 

a) weekend b) Monday c) Tuesday  

3. Does Mr Eddie help people?  

a) yes b) no  

4. Is Mr Eddie a kind man?  

a) Yes  b) No 

                   

Fill in the blank spaces with the right homophones  

1. …………….the race ( one /won)  

2. My mother will ………….. the school bag for me ( buy /bye) 

3. I was so hungry, I ……….my entire dinner ( eight/ ate)  

4.  My ……….aunt bought a new bike (ant /aunt)  

5.  What do you want to ……….. in future? ( bee/ be)  

       

 Complete with letters ending with "er", "sh", "st", "ck" 

1. broth _ _ 

2. ru _ _ 

3. co _ _ 

4. Lett _ _ 

5. be _ _ 

6. ne _ _ 

7. pa _ _ 

8. thir _ _ 

9. cla _ _ 

10. we _ _ 

 

Add  ‘ing’ correctly to words in brackets. Use them to fill in the gaps 

1.  Ada loves …………..rice everyday ( cook) 

2. The dog is ………..(bark)  

3. The students are ………. Mathematics (learn) 

4. Michelle is……….. to her teacher (listen) 

5. I love ……….. with my friends ( dance)  

 

Write 5 words starting with 'er', 'sh', 'st', 'ch' 

1. __________.          1. ____________.        1. ___________.         1. ____________ 

2. __________.          2. ____________.        2. ___________.         2. ____________ 

3. __________.          3. ____________.        3. ___________.         3. ___________ 

4. ___________.        4. ____________.        4. ___________.         4. ___________ 

5. ___________.        5. ____________.        5. ___________.         5. ___________ 

 

Make two-letter words from the words below: 

1. Bear ______ 

2. Toe _______ 

3. Done _______ 

4. Soak ________ 

5. Wet _________ 

6. Meat ______ 

7. Knew _______ 

8. This _______ 

9. Sand ________ 

10. May ________

subject: Religious Studies
content:
C. R. S 

1. -------- is a request to God 

a. Prayer. b. Answer. c. Complaint  

2. We pray to God to ------ Him for what He has done 

a. Complain to. b. Deny. c. Praise 

3. Prayer means the words of --------- that we speak to God 

a. Association. b. Praises. c. Attitude 

4. We pray to God to beg for ------ of our sins 

a. Forgiveness. b. Obedience. c. Energy 

5. When we want to pray to God, we must  be ------ 

a. Crazy. b. Proud. c. Humble 

6. We must pray ------ 

a. Always. b. Sometimes. c. 2 days 

7. -------- is our Father 

a. Tinubu. b. God. c. Segun 

8. We should ------ Him as the Almighty 

a. Curse. b. Worship. c. Fear 

9. When we want to speak to God, we should -------- Him 

a. Respect. b. Disobey. c. Fear 

10. When we pray, our prayers are answered. 

a. True. b. False. c. Maybe 

11. The tax collector was ------- 

a. Ahead. b. Foolish. c. Humble 

12. The pharisee in the bible was -------- 

a. Humble. b. Proud. c. Innocent 

13. The prayer of the tax collector was answered 

a. True. b. False. c. Not really 

14. The prayer of the pharisee was answered 

a. True. b. False. c. Incase 

15. --------- is a communication between God and man. 

a. Evangelism. b. Prayer.  c. Microphone 

16. When we are praying, we should ------ our eyes 

a. Squeeze. b. Open. c. Close 

17. Our Father who art in ------ 

a. Heaven. b. Earth. c. Sea 

18. We should ------- even when we are tired and sleepy 

a. Snore. b. Pray. c. Curse 

19. Some have food but cannot ------- 

a. Feed. b. Eat. c. Farm 

20. We should honour God 

a. Maybe. b. Incase. c. True 

 

Section B 

1. What is the name of Jesus' mother _________ 

2. ________ and ________ are disciples of Jesus 

3. A ceremony in which someone is dipped into the water and brought out is called ________ 

4. Why did Zaccheaus climb a tree? __________ 

5. This is my beloved son in whom I am well _______ 

 

Section C. Theory 

1. Name two people that Jesus raised from the dead 

2. In what ways can you prepare for the kingdom of God 

3. Name five(5) disciples of Jesus Christ 

4. Mention three(3) ways we can help the sick and 
 needy 

5. Mention three(3) ways we can serve God

subject: National Values
content:
National value  

1. ……………..is a collection of people living together in a particular place  

a) community  

b) Culture  

c) Education  

2. Culture is the way of ……….? 

a) Education  

b) Life 

c) Communicating  

3. …………. Is the  ability to distinguish between right and wrong? 

a.) Joy 

b) Music 

c) Conscience  

4. ………. Is a type of community  

a) traditional community  

b) Muslim community  

c) Cultural community  

5. ………… is any substance we eat to give us energy and build tissue? 

a) water 

b) Food 

c) Energy  

6. When you eat together as family it promote…… 

a) happiness  

b) sadness  

c) bitterness  

7. …………… is the uncomfortable feelings? 

a) guilt 

b) Humility  

c) Conscience 

8. Carbohydrate gives…….   

A)weakness  

b) weapon  

c)energy  

9. .…….is an example of traditional community  

a) city  

b)village  

c)school 

10. One of the ways of greeting  

a) clapping  

b) jumping  

c) shaking hands  

11. ……… is the law installed to guard pedestrians, cyclists and motorists  

a)railway  

b)traffic Signs and light  

c)safety 

12. All except one is not disadvantages of foreign culture on our culture  

a)Education  

b) immorality  

c) violence  

13. …….. is the coming of man and woman to become husband and wife 

 a) cult  

b) marriage  

c) school  

14. ……helps to promote and preserve our culture 

 a) cultural festival  

b) praying  

c) preserving  

15. .....…is a way of showing appreciation, respect and good will towards people  

a) praying  

b) greeting 

c) eating  

16. All are examples of mass media except …… 

a) television 

 b)newspaper 

 c) printer 

17. .……..is a feature of environment except  

a) land 

 b) water  

c) Drum 

18. …….. is a form of greeting  

a) kneeling 

 b) lapping 

 c) jumping  

19. ..…… refers to all the things and creatures around us  

a) compound 

 b) environment 

c)animals  

 

20. ------- is the way of life of a people 

a) Culture 

b) Life 

c) Comfort 

 

 

Section B 

1. Example of things found in our environment are………..,…….. and ……… 

2. ………. Is an example of harmful substances  

3. Carbohydrate gives ……........ 

4. Protein helps us to ……........ 

5. When we eat together as family it promotes……

1)  What is harmful substances? 

 2)  Give two examples of harmful substances  

    ……….,...... 

    …………...... 

3. List three ways of preventing harmful substances 

…………........ 

…………........ 

………….......

a. DSS 

b. NAFDAC 

5. What is the full meaning of 

a. INEC 

b. EFCC

subject: PreVocational Studies
content:
P.V.S.           

1. The farm insects that eat up and destroy crops on the farm are called __________ 

a. Useful farm  b. Harmful farm  c. Harmful farm insects 

2. The farm insects includes _______ and ______ 

a. Weevil, mosquitoes  b. Ants, cockroach. C. Locust, termites 

3. ----------- cause sickness to animals 

a. Typhoid. b. Malaria. c. Harmful farm insects 

4. Some pests are parasites 

a. True.  b. False.  c. Maybe 

5. Pests affects --------- 

a. Crops, farm animals.  b. Human-beings. c. Classroom 

6. The pests that causes damages to crops are -------- and -------- 

a. Rodents, beetle. b. Frog, toad. c. Lion, elephant 

7. Some of the pests causes damages to crops on the --------- 

a. Road. b. Farm. c. Grass 

8. Some of the pests attack Stored -------- 

a. Crops. b. Books.  c. Desk 

9. A ------- is an organism that spends it's life living on --------- 

a. Solid food. b. Other organisms. c. Fats and oil 

10. They feed and live on their -------- 

a. Guests. b. Visitors. c. Hosts 

11. Their -------- suffers and may eventually die 

a. Passenger. b. Hosts. c. Hostess 

12. Examples of these parasites are ---------- and ---------- 

a. Lice, tsetse fly. b. Mosquitoes, fly. c. Wall gecko, electric ant 

13. You are to ------ farm products properly before you store them 

a. Air fry. b. Dry. c. Fan 

14. You should prevent --------- water around the house 

a. Rain.  b. Well. c. Stagnant 

15. We are to ----------- our surroundings to keep a clean environment 

a. Destroy.  b. Kill. c. Clear 

16. An ------- is a creature that lives inside the soil 

a. Earthworm. b. Guinea fowl. c. Hippopotamus  

17. -------- is always known as a farmers friend 

a.  Dog.  b. Earthworm.  c. Lion 

18. --------- and --------- are known as the farmers enemies 

a. Turkey, chicken. b. Moth, caterpillar. c. Rodents, birds 

19. Examples of Rodents are ----------- and --------- 

a. Grass cutter, rats.   b. Cockroach, insects.  c. Lion, scorpion 

20. Examples of Birds are -------- 

a. Orangutan. b. Hawk. c. Rats  

 

Section B 

1. Some pests are parasites. True / False 

2. A parasite is an organism that spends some of their lives in or on another organism. True/False.  

3. Parasites feed and live in their hosts. True / False  

4. . Earthworm is referred to as a farmers friend. True / False 

5. An earthworm is a human being that lives inside the soil. True/ False 

 

Section C Theory  

1. What is an Earthworm? 

2. What is Exercise? 

3. Mention three(3) types of exercise  

4.  Give three (3) importance of exercise to human body 

5. What is Jogging?

subject: Math
content:
Mathematics
      Add the following numbers
1. 5 + 6 + 8 = a. 15  b. 18  c. 19
2.  10 + 11 + 11 = a. 32  b. 25  c. 33
3. 22 + 22 = a. 33  b. 44  c. 55
4.  45 - 20 - 10 = a. 24  b. 15  c. 24
5. 20 - 10 - 10 = a. 50  b. 0  c. 20

6. 18            25
7.  26            35
8. 3 + 2              3 + 4
9. 1 + 7               4 + 3
10. N 1.95           N 1. 89
 11. Three friends shared 15 sweets. How many did each get? a. 3  b. 4  c. 5
12. How much is twenty three more than thirty? a. 33  b. 43  c. 53
13. What is this shape? 
                        

  a. triangle  b. rectangle  c. semi circle
14. Molly is 4cm taller than Jenny. Jenny is 104cm, so Molly is. a. 100cm  b. 108cm  c. 106cm
15. Raffle tickets are N20.00 each. How many can I buy with N 40.00? a. 5  b. 2  c. 4

Subtract the following
19. 1.23 - 0.38   a. 0.85  b. 1.45  c. 0.68
20. 1.53 - 0.29   a. 1.24  b. 1.80  c. 1.50
